member.summary: The WM_SIZECLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.ASKCBFORMATNAME
member.summary: The WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window to request the name of a CF_OWNERDISPLAY clipboard format.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.CHANGECBCHAIN
member.summary: The WM_CHANGECBCHAIN message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when a window is being removed from the chain.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.HSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window. This occurs when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's horizontal scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: This message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: This message is sent by the OS to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus realizes its logical palette. This message enables windows that do not have the keyboard focus to realize their logical palettes and update their client areas.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.HOTKEY
member.summary: The WM_HOTKEY message is posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function. The message is placed at the top of the message queue associated with the thread that registered the hot key.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.APPCOMMAND
member.summary: The WM_APPCOMMAND message notifies a window that the user generated an application command event, for example, by clicking an application command button using the mouse or typing an application command key on the keyboard.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.THEMECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_THEMECHANGED message is broadcast to every window following a theme change event. Examples of theme change events are the activation of a theme, the deactivation of a theme, or a transition from one theme to another.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.CLIPBOARDUPDATE
member.summary: Sent when the contents of the clipboard have changed.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED
member.summary: The system will send a window the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED message to indicate that the availability of desktop composition has changed.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.DWMNCRENDERINGCHANGED
member.summary: WM_DWMNCRENDERINGCHANGED is called when the non-client area rendering status of a window has changed. Only windows that have set the flag DWM_BLURBEHIND.fTransitionOnMaximized to true will get this message.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.DWMCOLORIZATIONCOLORCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when the colorization color has changed.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE
member.summary: WM_DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE will let you know when a DWM composed window is maximized. You also have to register for this message as well. You'd have other windowd go opaque when this message is sent.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.GETTITLEBARINFOEX
member.summary: Sent to request extended title bar information. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.APP
member.summary: The WM_APP constant is used by applications to help define private messages, usually of the form WM_APP+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.USER
member.summary: The WM_USER constant is used by applications to help define private messages for use by private window classes, usually of the form WM_USER+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.CPL_LAUNCH
member.summary: An application sends the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message to Windows Control Panel to request that a Control Panel application be started.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.CPL_LAUNCHED
member.summary: The WM_CPL_LAUNCHED message is sent when a Control Panel application, started by the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message, has closed. The WM_CPL_LAUNCHED message is sent to the window identified by the wParam parameter of the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message that started the application.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WM.SYSTIMER
member.summary: WM_SYSTIMER is a well-known yet still undocumented message. Windows uses WM_SYSTIMER for internal actions like scrolling.

member.name: T:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles
member.summary: Window Styles. The following styles can be specified wherever a window style is required. After the control has been created, these styles cannot be modified, except as noted.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window usually has a caption and a border.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. Cannot be used with the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. Cannot be used with the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. For use with the style only.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a paint message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapped child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. (If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not given and child windows overlap, when you draw within the client area of a child window, it is possible to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.) For use with the style only.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when you draw within the parent window. Used when you create the parent window.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window of maximum size.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window with a double border but no title.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Control-menu box in its title bar. Used only for windows with title bars.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window with a thick frame that can be used to size the window.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls in which the user can move from one control to the next with the arrow keys. All controls defined with the WS_GROUP style FALSE after the first control belong to the same group. The next control with the WS_GROUP style starts the next group (that is, one group ends where the next begins).

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies one of any number of controls through which the user can move by using the TAB key. The TAB key moves the user to the next control specified by the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Minimize button.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Maximize button.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (implies the style). Cannot be used with the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_TILED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_ICONIC
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the , , , , , and styles. Same as the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the , , , , , and styles.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window with the , , and styles. The WS_CAPTION style must be combined with the style to make the Control menu visible.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the style.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Designates a window with a double border that may (optionally) be created with a title bar when you specify the style flag in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style will not send the message to its parent window when the child window is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all nontopmost windows and stay above them even when the window is deactivated. An application can use the member function to add or remove this attribute.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-and-drop files.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style is to be transparent. That is, any windows that are beneath the window are not obscured by the window. A window created with this style receives messages only after all sibling windows beneath it have been updated.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates an MDI child window.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window, which is a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the task bar or in the window that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a 3D look — that is, a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a message.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: Gives a window generic right-aligned properties. This depends on the window class.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Gives window generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: Displays the window text using right-to-left reading order properties.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Displays the window text using left-to-right reading order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Places a vertical scroll bar to the left of the client area.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Places a vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: Allows the user to navigate among the child windows of the window by using the TAB key.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the and styles.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the and styles.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Creates a layered window. Note that this cannot be used for child windows. Also, this cannot be used if the window has a class style of either or .

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A window created with this style does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Arabic and Hebrew versions of Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Creates a window whose horizontal origin is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Windows XP: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. For more information, see Remarks. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either or .

member.name: F:WHC.OrderWater.Commons.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the or function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the style.

member.summary: Sets the animation clip that will be displayed in the system tray
